title: 112_hr2440
content: The Act may be cited as the "Market Transparency and Taxpayer Protection Act of 2011". It includes provisions for the disposition of non-mission critical assets. The Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency requires each enterprise to submit a report identifying all valuable assets and their characteristics within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The Director then determines which assets are critical to the enterprise's mission based on the report. The Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency requires each enterprise to submit a report identifying valuable assets within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The determinations include patents and historical mortgage data. Annual plans must be established for the sale or disposition of non-mission critical assets in compliance with specified requirements. The enterprise must identify non-mission critical assets to be sold or disposed of during the annual plan period, including patents and historical mortgage data. Sales or dispositions should comply with specified requirements under the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992. Additional information may be included as deemed appropriate by the Director. The Director must implement each annual plan within 90 days of its establishment. Within 36 months of the Act's enactment, all non-mission critical assets of each enterprise must be divested. The Director must submit a report to Congress on non-mission critical assets within 90 days after the conclusion of each annual plan period. The definitions for the terms "annual plan period" and "charter Act" are provided for the purpose of implementing the divestment of non-mission critical assets of enterprises like the Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation. The Director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency defines terms such as "enterprise" and "non-mission critical assets" in accordance with the Federal Housing Enterprises Financial Safety and Soundness Act of 1992.
